definitions: with a sharp or steeply tapering edge or point
with a sudden, piercing physical sensation or effect; intensely
in a critical or hurtful manner; strongly or harshly

examples.text: the plans have been sharply criticized
he made enemies by his sharply worded attacks on opponents

definitions: in a way that is distinct in outline or detail; clearly

examples.text: the waitress had a sharply defined jaw

definitions: with a sudden and marked change; dramatically
with a sudden change of direction

examples.text: his car swerved sharply to the left
each roof has ends that curve sharply upward

definitions: with speed of perception, comprehension, or response

examples.text: he had to react sharply to repel a shot at his near post

shortDefinitions: with speed of perception or response
